instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: so this laptop has sound issues.  i don't know how to proceed with this so would appreciate some insight.   the laptop always chimes, always get sound on headphones and mic is always working.  i get sound for around 15seconds to 2 min of sound on speakers on a fresh startup.  after that no sound.  if i power down by holding power button and turn back on sound comes back on for a bit.  where to start on this?  why would it stop working?  I reflowed <CHIP>U6500</CHIP>/50 and <CHIP>U6400</CHIP>/50 with no change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any history available?
The audio codec still recognized in system report, when the problem appears?
Lose sound on headphones too?
The system detects when you plug/unplug headpones?
Did you try another audio board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
board is clean.  customer came in with this problem
The audio codec is still recognized in system report even when no sound.
i never lose sound in headphones and is detected
audio board?  i thought everything is on the board on this model?  do you mean headphone jack cable (not sure if the audio ic is on headphone jack?)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes, audio jack board; to discard a problem with sense pin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: okay i ordered the audio jack board.  will let you know after it arrives

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
When you plug/unplug the headphones, macOS shows the changes on the audio outputs?
Check that when the problem appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: yes always working and showing up when headphones connected.  can i post a video link so you can see?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Save data and try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Save data and try DFU restore.
